title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to the Seahawks 29-13 at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
Christian Gonzalez and Craig Woodson were defensive standouts, with Gonzalez breaking up three passes.
Patriots' offensive line struggled, contributing to six sacks on Drake Maye and forcing an abandonment of the run game.

title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye and the New England Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX.
Maye was responsible for three turnovers, leading to 17 points for the Seahawks in the second half.
Despite the loss, Maye expressed optimism about the Patriots' future, praising the team and support staff.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny headlined the Super Bowl 60 halftime show, emphasizing joy and Latin culture at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
The performance featured medleys of hits and guest appearances by Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin, and other celebrities.
Despite conservative criticism, the show highlighted unity, ending with a message of love on the Jumbotron.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Jay-Z, Peyton Manning, and Lady Gaga were among the celebrities attending Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.
Bad Bunny headlined the halftime show joined by performers Cardi B, Karol G, and Lady Gaga.
Former NFL stars Peyton Manning, Tom Brady, and Drew Brees attended and participated in game tributes.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn about a fake social media account impersonating a female trooper with over 100,000 followers.
The account 'Sarita' on Instagram uses AI-generated content and links to an OnlyFans page sharing adult content.
A similar account with nearly 300,000 followers impersonates a Santa Monica officer using the same AI model but different settings.

title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alma Cantina on Union Street hosted a Seahawks watch party for Seattle fans during the Super Bowl in Patriots territory.
More than 100 Seahawks fans reserved spots at Alma Cantina, with overflow crowds accommodated at neighboring White Bull Tavern.
The event was organized by the Boston Seahawks Fan Facebook group, which started 13 years ago to connect local fans.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs shoved to the ground as punches fly during sideline scuffle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Stefon Diggs and Seattle's Josh Jobe were involved in a sideline altercation during the game.
Jobe shoved Diggs to the ground, and a scuffle ensued with Jobe appearing to throw punches at Diggs.
Diggs, facing charges from a December incident, has an arraignment scheduled for February 13.

title: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center due to a train derailment at Park Street station.
The MBTA announced on social media that the train was rerailed several hours after the incident occurred.
Investigations and repairs at Park Street station are ongoing, with service still suspended as of Sunday night.

title: ‘Good Will Dunkin’: Watch Ben Affleck, Tom Brady, Jennifer Aniston, and more in 2026 Super Bowl commercial
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in a Dunkin' Super Bowl ad parodying 'Good Will Hunting' with '90s sitcom stars and Tom Brady.
The commercial aired before halftime of Super Bowl LX, featuring Jason Alexander, Alfonso Ribeiro, and others.
Jennifer Aniston and Tom Brady appear in the ad, with Aniston's character breaking up with Affleck's Will Hunting.

title: Here’s Ann Michael Maye’s custom look for Super Bowl Sunday
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ann Michael Maye wore a custom cropped Patriots jacket by Kristin Juszczyk to Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.
Married to Patriots QB Drake Maye, Ann Michael starred in a DoorDash Super Bowl ad with Katie Hoofnagle.
Ann Michael Maye gained social media fame in 2025 for her viral baking videos and Boston-based baking show.
